content: daisy hand towel designed by lisa hounshell this pattern uses breakaway crochet method techniques if you haven t done so already please refer to the following instructional material before attempting this pattern for more information on the breakaway crochet method in general please visit the website to work a practice swatch using the daisy motif visit the breakaway motif library for a demonstration of techniques used in this specific project please watch this youtube video materials yarn flinders 8 ply cotton each ball = 1 76 ounces / 50 gms 126 yards / 115 meters ● 1 ball for daisy section ● 2 balls for solid section hook us size g / 4mm stitch marker measurements width 11 ½ / 29 cm height unfolded 31 ½ / 80 cm gauge double_crochet 19 sts x 10 row = 4 / 10 cm abbreviations us terminology slip_stitch slip_stitch slstb slip_stitch between the current daisyand the next one chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet tr2tog treble 2 together bigftr2tog big floating treble 2 together - yarn over twice make a larger than usual floating ring yarn over pull through 2 loops twice yarn over twice insert hook into floating ring and pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops twice yarn over and pull through all 3 loops on hook ba breakaway from the current daisy and start a new one as instructed petal ch4 tr2tog ch4 slip_stitch join slip_stitch into the 6th petal behind the hook pattern notes the towel is worked in 2 sections the daisy section and the solid section the daisy section is worked first starting with the daisy that sits right at the point near the bottom edge the daisies are worked in diagonal row with both edges widening over the first 4 row of daisies the piece then narrows at both edges with the left edge becoming the vertical left edge of the section and the right edge becoming the top horizontal edge for the solid section work begins across the top of the daisy section and proceeds in row of double_crochet until the desired length is reached instructions all stitches are worked into the floating ring of the current motif unless otherwise stated daisy section 1 foundation row using daisy yarn bigftr2tog ch4 slip_stitch 2 petals ch4 tr2tog 4 times 4 daisies started 2 return row ch4 slip_stitch 2 petals ch4 slstb 3 times ch4 slip_stitch petal ch4 tr2tog 3 joined foundation row bigftr2tog ch4 slip_stitch ch4 tr2tog * ba bigftr2tog ch4 slip_stitch ch4 tr2tog join ch4 slip_stitch 2 times ch4 tr2tog repeat from * 2 more times ba bigftr2tog ch4 slip_stitch ch4 tr2tog join ch4 slip_stitch petal ch4 tr2tog 5 daisies started 4 return row ch4 slip_stitch 2 petals ch4 slstb 4 times ch4 slip_stitch petal ch4 tr2tog 5 joined foundation row bigftr2tog ch4 slip_stitch ch4 tr2tog * ba bigftr2tog ch4 slip_stitch ch4 tr2tog join ch4 slip_stitch 2 times ch4 tr2tog repeat from * 3 more times ba bigftr2tog ch4 slip_stitch ch4 tr2tog
